metadata.title: USN-6435-2 -- OpenSSL vulnerabilities
metadata.description: USN-6435-1 fixed vulnerabilities in OpenSSL. This update provides the corresponding updates for Ubuntu 20.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   It was discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled excessively large  Diffie-Hellman parameters. An attacker could possibly use this issue  to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2023-3446)    Bernd Edlinger discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled excessively  large Diffie-Hellman parameters. An attacker could possibly use this  issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2023-3817)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6435-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libssl1.1 - 1.1.1f-1ubuntu2.20 libssl-dev - 1.1.1f-1ubuntu2.20 openssl - 1.1.1f-1ubuntu2.20 libssl-doc - 1.1.1f-1ubuntu2.20 No subscription required
